keyTakeAways: Lance Bass has type 1.5 diabetes, also known as latent autoimmune diabetes of adults (LADA).
He uses the Dexcom G7 Continuous Glucose Monitoring System to track his blood sugar levels effectively.
Bass created an online persona called 'Blood Sugar Lance' to educate the public about diabetes with humor and to provide entertainment.
The persona was developed accidentally and is used to make people laugh during stressful times.
Certain foods—especially white rice and white bread—cause significant blood sugar spikes in Bass, even with insulin treatment.
His uncle had type 1 diabetes, and growing up he learned about the importance of sugar-free diets.
Advancements in diabetes technology and community support have made managing diabetes easier for him.
Stress from his busy career and parenting his four-year-old twins affects his blood sugar levels.
Lance Bass has no plans for an *NSYNC reunion tour at this time, stating that there is no current news on the matter.
He has dismissed recent media reports about a possible NSYNC reunion as inaccurate.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Lance Bass, former member of the boy band *NSYNC, discusses his current focus on managing type 1.5 diabetes (LADA) rather than addressing reunion rumors. He shares how the Dexcom G7 continuous glucose monitoring system has transformed his daily management, allowing him to identify foods like white rice and white bread that cause dangerous blood sugar spikes. Bass created a humorous online persona, 'Blood Sugar Lance,' on Instagram to educate the public about diabetes with light-hearted content. He also highlights the emotional and practical challenges of living with diabetes while managing a busy career and parenting his two young children. Despite fan speculation about a potential *NSYNC reunion, Bass confirms there is no current plan, and he has dismissed recent media reports as inaccurate.
title: Lance Bass has more to say about living with diabetes than he does about an *NSYNC reunion
